intro: Halocharis sulphurea, commonly known as golden halocharis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Halocharis sulphurea thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
